author: jpw_axiom
content: <@1408119112743256134> I approved the IO PR, but on https://github.com/eth-act/zkvm-standards/pull/8#discussion_r2767700555 I feel like there's some behavior on the host side that needs to be specified here: if you allow `write_output` to include hashing within the implementation, then you must require the plaintext output to be included in the proof serialization, and then the proof verifier must check that the the hash of the output matches the hash. Otherwise the output is not truly an output: it's still a private input that is only committed to via the hash.
